qas.question: What may a person display in terms of both exploration and commitments?
What is the permutation when a person lacks exploration and commitment?
What is the permutation when a person has not chosen goals in the past but is willing to in the future?
What is the permutation when a person is ready to make commitments but unable to commit?
What is the permutation when a person commits to identity choices?
What is both relatively weak or relatively strong?
What is the permutation when a person embraces exploration and commitment?
What is a permutation when a person is not ready to make a commitment?
What is a permutation when a person cannot make an identity choice wants to commit to them?

context: A person may display either <a0_0>relative weakness or relative strength<a0_0/> in terms of both <b5_0>exploration and commitments.<b5_0/> When assigned categories, four possible permutations result: <a1_0><b6_0>identity diffusion<b6_0/><a1_0/>, <a2_0>identity foreclosure<a2_0/>, <a3_0>identity moratorium<a3_0/>, and <a4_0>identity achievement<a4_0/>. Diffusion is when a person lacks both exploration in life and interest in committing even to those unchosen roles that he or she occupies. Foreclosure is when a person has not chosen extensively in the past, but seems willing to commit to some relevant values, goals, or roles in the future. <b7_0>Moratorium<b7_0/> is when a person displays a kind of flightiness, ready to make choices but unable to commit to them. Finally, <b8_0>achievement<b8_0/> is when a person makes identity choices and commits to them.
